intro: Commelina humblotii, commonly known as the Humblot's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many species with showy inflorescences. The plant features slender, erect stems and produces small, blue-violet flowers clustered in umbels. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a waxy texture. Commelina humblotii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
